item.title: 特朗普新任联邦贸易委员会主席如何看待人工智能和大科技
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）挑选的美国联邦贸易委员会主席安德鲁-弗格森（Andrew Ferguson）表示，希望在监管人工智能方面采取放手态度的同时，对大科技公司穷追猛打。【原文：Andrew Ferguson, President-elect Donald Trump's pick to chair the U.S. Federal Trade Commission, has expressed the desire to go after Big Tech companies while taking a hands-off approach to regulating artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州就未成年人安全和隐私问题调查科技平台
item.description: 得克萨斯州总检察长肯-帕克斯顿（Ken Paxton）周四表示，他的办公室对十多个技术平台的未成年人隐私和安全措施展开了调查。【原文：Texas Attor­ney Gen­er­al Ken Pax­ton said on Thursday his office launched investigations into over a dozen technology platforms over their privacy and safety practices for minors.】

item.title: 特朗普称自动化对码头工人弊大于利
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，工作场所自动化所节省的资金不足以证明其对工人，尤其是码头工人造成的伤害是合理的。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said on Thursday the money saved by automation in the workplace is not enough to justify the harm it causes to workers, especially longshoremen.】

item.title: 美联储批准丰业银行收购 KeyCorp 有投票权股份的出价
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）周四表示，它已批准丰业银行（Scotiabank）购买美国地区性贷款机构 KeyCorp 最多 14.99% 有投票权股份的申请，因为这家加拿大银行希望提高其在发达市场的风险敞口。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve said on Thursday it had approved an application by Scotiabank to buy up to 14.99% of the voting shares in U.S. regional lender KeyCorp , as the Canadian bank looks to boost its exposure to developed markets.】

item.title: 美国银行业巨头摩根大通选举好时首席执行官米歇尔-巴克进入董事会
item.description: 美国银行业巨头摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）周四宣布，好时公司首席执行官米歇尔-巴克（Michele Buck）当选其董事会成员，并于 3 月 17 日生效。【原文：U.S. banking powerhouse JPMorgan Chase on Thursday announced the election of Hershey's CEO Michele Buck to its board, effective March 17.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 Insignia Financial 获得贝恩资本 17 亿美元收购要约
item.description: 澳大利亚 Insignia Financial 公司周五表示，已收到私募股权贝恩资本（Bain Capital）提出的非约束性收购建议，对这家财富管理公司的估值为 26.7 亿澳元（17.0 亿美元）。【原文：Australia's Insignia Financial said on Friday it has received a non-binding takeover proposal from private equity Bain Capital, valuing the wealth manager at A$2.67 billion ($1.70 billion).】

item.title: 早间新闻中国深化刺激政策，全球信号喜忧参半
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 纽约联储市场部主管尼尔辞职，将于 2025 年 3 月离职
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行周四发布新闻稿称，该行强大的市场部门主管米歇尔-尼尔（Michelle Neal）即将卸任，并将于 2025 年 3 月离开该行。【原文：The head of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York's powerful Markets Group, Michelle Neal, is stepping down and will leave the bank in March 2025, the bank said in a press releaseon Thursday.】

item.title: Broadcom 预测第一季度收入高于预期
item.description: 博通公司（Broadcom）周四预测其第一季度营收将高于华尔街预期，该公司押注于云供应商对其定制人工智能芯片和网络设备的蓬勃需求，并加倍努力采用 GenAI 基础设施。【原文：Broadcom forecast its first-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, betting on booming demand for its custom artificial intelligence chips and networking gear from cloud providers doubling down on GenAI infrastructure adoption.】

item.title: 由于假日需求稳定，好市多季度销售额超出预期
item.description: 好市多批发公司（Costco Wholesale）周四公布的第一季度营收略高于华尔街预期，原因是越来越多的美国人在节日期间转向这家会员制零售连锁店，购买从食品到家居用品等各种商品。【原文：Costco Wholesale marginally beat Wall Street expectations for first-quarter revenue on Thursday, as more Americans turned to the membership-only retail chain to shop for everything from food to home furnishings for the holiday season.】

item.title: 美国声称朝鲜让工人在美国公司工作以勒索钱财购买武器
item.description: 美国周四悬赏 500 万美元征集有关朝鲜技术人员在毫无戒心的美国公司谋职，然后窃取其商业机密索取赎金，并将所得用于资助平壤武器计划的信息。【原文：The United States on Thursday offered a $5 million reward for information about an alleged scheme in which North Korean technology workers got jobs at unsuspecting U.S. companies then stole their trade secrets for ransom, with the proceeds used to fund Pyongyang's weapons programs.】

item.title: 阿根廷第三季度经济萎缩 2.6%，但衰退仍有可能打破
item.description: 预计 2024 年第三季度阿根廷经济将比上年同期萎缩 2.6%，连续第六个季度下滑，但比上一季度有所增长，打破了自去年年底以来的技术性衰退。【原文：Argentina's economy is expected to have contracted 2.6% in the third quarter of 2024 versus a year earlier, the sixth straight such decline, but expanded against the quarter before, breaking a technical recession going back to the end of last year.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，苹果公司即将为 iPhone 和智能家居改用自主研发的蓝牙和 Wi-Fi 芯片
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，苹果公司计划从明年开始在其设备的蓝牙和 Wi-Fi 连接上改用国产芯片，此举将逐步淘汰目前由博通公司（Broadcom）提供的部分部件。【原文：Apple is planning to switch to a homegrown chip for Bluetooth and Wi-Fi connections for its devices starting next year, a move that will phase out some parts currently supplied by Broadcom , Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 隐形眼镜制造商博士伦表示正在探索出售事宜
item.description: 博士伦公司周四表示，除其他选择外，该公司正在探索潜在的出售方案，此举将有助于加拿大母公司博士健康公司退出这家眼科保健公司。【原文：Bausch + Lomb is exploring a potential sale among other options, it said on Thursday, in a move that would help Canadian parent Bausch Health exit the eye-care company.】

item.title: 波音计划到 2026 年将 787 的月产量提高到 10 架
item.description: 波音公司周四表示，计划到 2026 年将 787 Dreamliner 宽体喷气式飞机的产量提高到每月 10 架。【原文：Boeing said on Thursday it plans to increase production of its 787 Dreamliner widebody jets to 10 planes per month by 2026.】

item.title: 美国两州起诉格洛克公司改装机枪
item.description: 明尼苏达州和新泽西州的总检察长周四起诉格洛克公司，指控该公司制造的手枪很容易被改装成非法机枪，通过一种被称为 "格洛克开关 "的廉价附加装置就能开火。【原文：Attorneys general in Minnesota and New Jersey sued Glock on Thursday, accusing the company of making handguns that are easily modified to fire as illegal machine guns through a cheap add-on known as a “Glock switch.”】

item.title: 华尔街希望降息能在 2025 年迫使客户抛出现金
item.description: 参加路透社在纽约举行的 Next 会议的华尔街高管预计，随着宽松的货币政策吸引客户撤出极端保守的资产类别，2024 年证明不受利率下降影响的 7 万亿美元现金堆将在明年开始融化。【原文：Wall Street executives at the Reuters Next conference in New York expect a $7-trillion cash pile that proved invulnerable to falling interest rates in 2024 to start melting next year as easier monetary policy tempts clients out of the ultra-conservative asset class.】

item.title: 美国电网级储能在第三季度的安装和部署量均创历史新高
item.description: 伍德麦肯兹公司（Wood Mackenzie）周四在一份报告中称，美国储能市场在第三季度实现了创纪录的增长，安装量达到 3,806 兆瓦（MW），发电量达到 9,931 兆瓦时（MWh）。【原文：U.S. energy storage market saw record growth in the third quarter with 3,806 megawatts (MW) worth installations and 9,931 megawatt-hours (MWh) deployed, Wood Mackenzie said in a report on Thursday.】

item.title: 联邦贸易委员会重启价格歧视法，起诉酒类经销商
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周四起诉酒类经销商 Southern Glazer's，称其给予大客户独家折扣，数十年来首次执行旨在保护小型零售商免受大型竞争对手侵害的法律。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission sued alcohol distributor Southern Glazer's on Thursday for giving big customers exclusive discounts, enforcing a law aimed at protecting small retailers from bigger competitors for the first time in decades.】

item.title: 房地产经纪人组织预测 2025 年美国 30 年期固定利率抵押贷款平均利率为 6
item.description: 全美房地产经纪人协会（National Association of Realtors）周四预测，明年美国流行的 30 年期固定利率抵押贷款的平均利率将在 6.0% 左右，这将有助于推动新房建设，刺激对旧房的需求。【原文：The rate on the popular U.S. 30-year fixed-rate mortgage will average around 6.0% next year and help to boost new housing construction and stimulate demand for previously owned homes, the National Association of Realtors predicted on Thursday.】

item.title: 普华永道称，受政治不确定性影响，去年美国电力交易下降 36
item.description: 普华永道周四发布报告称，由于 11 月 5 日总统大选前的政治不确定性导致交易放缓，去年美国电力和公用事业交易额降至 278 亿美元，比 2023 年下降了 36%。【原文：The value of U.S. power and utilities deals fell over the last year to $27.8 billion, down by 36% from 2023, as political uncertainty ahead of the Nov. 5 presidential election slowed transactions, a PwC report said on Thursday.】

item.title: 软件初创公司 ServiceTitan 估值 89.7 亿美元，纳斯达克首日股价大涨 42
item.description: ServiceTitan 周四在美国市场首次亮相时股价上涨了约 42%，使这家基于云的软件公司估值达到 89.7 亿美元。【原文：Shares of ServiceTitan rose about 42% in their U.S. market debut on Thursday, giving the cloud-based software company a valuation of $8.97 billion.】

item.title: 香奈儿任命马修-布拉齐（Matthieu Blazy）为创意总监 - 报道
item.description: 据《女装日报》（Women's Wear Daily）和《金融时报》（Financial Times）周四报道，法国时装品牌香奈儿（Chanel）选择了前 Bottega Veneta 设计总监 Matthieu Blazy 担任下一任创意总监。【原文：French fashion house Chanel selected former Bottega Veneta design chief Matthieu Blazy as its next creative director, Women's Wear Daily and the Financial Times reported Thursday.】

item.title: Blackrock 建议感兴趣的投资者将比特币投资组合的权重提高至 2
item.description: 巨型资产管理公司贝莱德（Blackrock）在周四的一份报告中表示，建议感兴趣的投资者考虑将其投资组合中多达 2% 的资金分配给世界上最大的加密货币比特币。【原文：Blackrock recommends that interested investors consider allocating as much as 2% of their portfolio to bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, the giant asset manager said in a report on Thursday.】

item.title: 巴西矿业公司淡水河谷投资美国初创企业，推动去碳化进程
item.description: 巴西矿业公司淡水河谷（Vale）的企业风险投资计划淡水河谷风险投资公司（Vale Ventures）周四表示，它已经投资了一家总部位于波士顿的初创公司，该公司致力于开发供热脱碳解决方案。【原文：Vale Ventures, the corporate venture capital initiative of Brazilian miner Vale , said on Thursday it has invested in a Boston-based startup focused on developing solutions to decarbonize heat generation.】

item.title: 美国 30 年期固定利率抵押贷款降至 6.60
item.description: 本周，美国抵押贷款利率降至近两个月来的最低水平，这一趋势如果持续下去，可能会促进未来几个月的房屋销售。【原文：U.S. mortgage rates dropped to the lowest level in nearly two months this week, a trend that if sustained could boost home sales in the coming months.】

item.title: 英特尔高管称有可能分拆制造业务
item.description: 英特尔公司首席执行官下台后，领导该公司的两位高管周四表示，公司可能会分拆其制造部门。【原文：The two executives leading Intel after the ouster of its chief executive said on Thursday that the company may spin out its manufacturing division.】

item.title: 据《环球邮报》报道，加拿大政府出售加航股份
item.description: 据《环球邮报》周四援引消息人士的话报道，加拿大政府已在过去几天内出售了其持有的加拿大航空公司约 6% 的股份。【原文：The Canadian government has sold its roughly 6% stake in Air Canada in the past few days, the Globe and Mail reported on Thursday, citing a source.】

item.title: 高管预测：2025 年，自主代理和盈利能力将主导人工智能议程
item.description: 企业高管和研究人员本周在纽约路透社 NEXT 会议上接受采访时预测，自主 "代理 "和盈利能力很可能主导明年的人工智能议程。【原文：Autonomous "agents" and profitability are likely to dominate the artificial intelligence agenda next year, business executives and researchers predicted this week in interviews at the Reuters NEXT conference in New York.】

item.title: Stifel 预计标准普尔 500 指数将在 2025 年初达到顶峰，然后回落
item.description: 周四，Stifel 预计 S&P 500 指数将在 2025 年上半年达到峰值，然后在下半年下跌 10%至 15%，该经纪公司称，原因是担心经济增长放缓和通胀持续。【原文：Stifel expects the S&P 500 index to peak in the first half of 2025, then fall 10% to 15% in the second half of the year, the brokerage said on Thursday citing concerns about slower economic growth and sticky inflation.】
